title: Debugger says "bad response" when using alchemy paid private RPC endpoint
body:
I've set up the Alchemy paid, private RPC endpoint for debugging and set the URL to "Custom - External Http Provider." Then I tried to debug the previously executed and was-reverted transaction. But by pushing the "Start debugging" button, the debugger said the error I pasted below:

```
bad response (status=400, headers={"content-length":"127","content-type":"application/json"}, body="{\"jsonrpc\":\"2.0\",\"id\":54,\"error\":{\"code\":-32602,\"message\":\"invalid 2nd argument: options object was missing 'tracer' element\"}}", requestBody="{\"method\":\"debug_traceTransaction\",\"params\":[\"0xtransaction hash\",{\"disableStorage\":true,\"enableMemory\":true,\"disableStack\":false,\"fullStorage\":false}],\"id\":54,\"jsonrpc\":\"2.0\"}", requestMethod="POST", url="https://polygon-mumbai.g.alchemy.com/v2/xxxxx", code=SERVER_ERROR, version=web/5.5.0)
```

It seems to be not supported Alchemy `debug_` endpoints, so please support Alchemy RPCs for debugging. Thanks.
